revised_title: Investigating the Accuracy of Bond-Length Estimations in X-ray Crystallography
tldr: The authors conducted an experimental study to determine the accuracy of bond-length estimations using double Fourier series methods from X-ray data. They investigated a hypothetical structure containing twelve atoms in general positions and found that the maximum error in a complex structure should not exceed 0.03 Å, with a probable error of about 0.015 Å for atom separations of between 1.0 and 1.4 Å. The study also showed that errors due to incomplete Fourier series and systematic errors in F values can affect the accuracy of bond-length estimations.
